record.description: A bright evening comet, the Arend-Roland has two tails. The main tail points away from the sun with a length estimated at 50,000,000 miles by University of Chicago's George A. Van Biesbroeck, professor emeritus of astronomy, who heads up a study group. However, he says, its most unusual feature is the long narrow jet which points toward the sun. This photograph was taken at McDonald Observatory using a 10-inch Cook lens.
